rules.natural: Whenever the alcohol company violates marketing rules, it targets minors.
If the organization cancels the sponsorship, then it issues a statement.
Provided that the alcohol company faces a lawsuit, it settles the case.
Either the alcohol company faces a lawsuit or it targets a family audience.
The alcohol company admits guilt or it does not settle the case.
Under the condition that the alcohol company hires a law firm, it does not admit guilt.
If the alcohol company conducts an internal review, then it does not admit guilt.
Either the alcohol company consults legal experts or it forms a compliance committee.

If the alcohol company seeks legal advice, then whenever it consults legal experts, it hires a law firm.
Under the condition that the alcohol company contacts external counsel, it seeks legal advice.
The alcohol company contacts external counsel or it uses internal lawyers.
Whenever the alcohol company uses internal lawyers, it seeks legal advice.
If the alcohol company implements new policies, then it changes its marketing strategy.
Provided that the alcohol company negotiates with sponsors, it maintains partnerships.
Under the condition that the alcohol company finds alternative funding, if it does not target minors, then it loses sponsorships.
If the alcohol company engages a PR firm, then it negotiates with sponsors or it finds alternative funding.
The alcohol company engages a PR firm or it handles public relations.
Provided that the alcohol company complies with rules, it avoids penalties.
Either the alcohol company complies with rules or the regulatory body receives approval for the alcohol company.

If the regulatory body receives approval for the alcohol company, then whenever it is not the case that not violating marketing rules implies the public receives a complaint, the organization cancels the sponsorship.
Under the condition that the alcohol company targets adults, it violates marketing rules.
If the alcohol company follows guidelines, then whenever it does not target adults, it uses proper channels.
If the alcohol company violates regulations, then it does not receive a fine.
Provided that the alcohol company ignores regulations, the organization continues the sponsorship.
If the alcohol company ignores regulations, then the organization terminates the agreement.
The alcohol company ignores regulations or, if it implements age verification, then it follows guidelines.
Provided that the alcohol company monitors compliance, if the organization terminates the agreement, then it does not continue the sponsorship.
Whenever the alcohol company resolves the dispute, it does not reach a settlement.
Under the condition that the alcohol company avoids court, it does not enter litigation.
Either the alcohol company avoids court or it accepts mediation.
Provided that the alcohol company accepts mediation, it does not enter litigation.
Whenever the alcohol company cooperates with authorities, if it denies wrongdoing, then it does not face a lawsuit.
The alcohol company challenges the ruling or it does not get sanctioned.
Under the condition that the alcohol company accepts the verdict, it does not challenge the ruling.
Either the alcohol company accepts the verdict or it modifies practices.
Provided that the alcohol company modifies practices, it does not challenge the ruling.
If the alcohol company receives a warning, then it receives a fine.
Whenever the alcohol company targets minors, if it does not target a family audience, then the show does not air during primetime.
If it is not the case that the alcohol company hires a law firm or conducts an internal review, then it takes no action.
If it is not the case that whenever the alcohol company handles public relations, it negotiates with sponsors or finds alternative funding, then it suffers reputation damage.
Provided that it is not the case that if the alcohol company violates regulations, then it receives a warning, it appeals the decision.
If it is not the case that the alcohol company resolves the dispute implies it reaches a settlement, then it enters litigation.

Under the condition that it is not the case that not (the alcohol company hires a law firm or conducts an internal review) implies it does not take no action, the alcohol company faces an investigation.

If it is not the case that not (not (the alcohol company hires a law firm or conducts an internal review) implies it does not take no action) implies the alcohol company does not face an investigation, then it resolves the dispute.

(¬(¬(¬G → A1) → A2) → ¬A3).natural: Under the condition that it is not the case that not (not (the alcohol company does not target a family audience implies it produces the show) implies the organization sponsors the show), the regulatory body does not approve the sponsorship.

(¬(¬A10 → A11) → A12).natural: If it is not the case that not (the alcohol company violates marketing rules implies the public receives a complaint), the organization issues a statement.

(¬(¬A10 → A11) → A13).natural: Whenever it is not the case that not (the alcohol company violates marketing rules implies the public receives a complaint), the organization cancels the sponsorship.

(¬(¬A53 → A54) → A55).natural: Provided that it is not the case that not (the alcohol company cooperates with authorities implies it provides documents), the alcohol company receives clearance.

(¬(¬G → A1) → A2).natural: Under the condition that it is not the case that not (the alcohol company does not target a family audience implies it produces the show), the organization sponsors the show.

(¬(¬G → A1) → ¬A2).natural: If it is not the case that not (the alcohol company does not target a family audience implies it produces the show), then the organization does not sponsor the show.

(¬A10 → A11).natural: Whenever the alcohol company does not violate marketing rules, the public receives a complaint.

(¬A10 → A25).natural: Provided that the alcohol company does not violate marketing rules, it changes its marketing strategy.

(¬A10 → A26).natural: Under the condition that the alcohol company does not violate marketing rules, it implements new policies.

(¬A10 → ¬A25).natural: If the alcohol company does not violate marketing rules, then it does not change its marketing strategy.

(¬A37 → A38).natural: Whenever the alcohol company does not target adults, it uses proper channels.

(¬A37 → ¬A38).natural: Provided that the alcohol company does not target adults, it does not use proper channels.

(¬A53 → A54).natural: Under the condition that the alcohol company does not cooperate with authorities, it provides documents.

(¬A53 → ¬A54).natural: If the alcohol company does not cooperate with authorities, then it does not provide documents.

(¬A9 → A27).natural: Whenever the alcohol company does not target minors, it loses sponsorships.

(¬G → A1).natural: Provided that the alcohol company does not target a family audience, it produces the show.

(¬G → A8).natural: Under the condition that the alcohol company does not target a family audience, the show airs during primetime.

(¬G → ¬A1).natural: If the alcohol company does not target a family audience, then it does not produce the show.

(¬G → ¬A8).natural: Whenever the alcohol company does not target a family audience, the show does not air during primetime.
